page.title: 06Gayton Village School
page.content: Gayton village school was built in 1900 and dedicated to the memory of Cecil Eykyn who was a Captain in the Black Watch. The "Eykyn" name can be seen in many places about the village. At the moment there are 20 children in the school aged between 5 and 11. Three years ago there were only 8. Some parents prefer to send their children to larger schools in other villages. There is only one full time teacher (the headmistress) and a part-time teacher for 1.5 days a week. Sometimes special teachers visit to teach music and science and art. The school has only two classrooms. The smaller is used for junior children when the second teacher is present. Although Northamptonshire opperates a 3 tier School system, schools in rural areas have the Primary/Secondary type.
